properties.name: Calcopus
properties.description: Game example to demonstrate usage of Spine object in Gdevelop.

objects.name: Hint
objects.string: Tap on a bubble with lowest value

content.text: Tap on a bubble with lowest value

events.comment: Activating masking for progress fill and progress edge, parenting edge to moving sprite
NewGame boolean to trigger new game block
BG music
Setting spine mix duration

TimePlayed - total playing time
Timer - for ticking progressbar each second
Unpausing "Timer", because it was paused during end game sequence
Restoring lost lives from previous game, using booleans in array and instance variable heart_id
Restoring progress bar
Hiding all bubbles, to then spawn only some of them

Resetting some control variables for new game

BubbleCount - how many bubble to spawn (updates with defined time interval)
CorrectAnswers - counting correct player answers
GameEnded - triggers by 0 lives or 0 time left
PopupReady - true, when popup has finished animation and play again button can be clicked
Time - how many seconds for progress bar to go from 100 to 0
PlayAgainPressed - triggers when player clicked Play Again button, to make button unavailable after first click
Clearing array with equations from previous game, populating array with tasks from first difficulty
Setting boolean to activate first bubble spawning

Triggered by boolean variable that turned false until further trigger. With each spawn we shuffle array with currently playable tasks. ArrayCounter is just to loop over values when filling them to text layers.
Sound effect for bubble spawning
Picking random not-visible bubble one by one several times (BubbleCount)
Showing one bubble using tweening and chosing one of 3 sprite variations
Creating text layer for one of equations, linking particular text layer to its bubble
Setting string value of text layer to one of two values in array for equation.
Setting object variable (to store data with particular bubble) to another value in array. Now we have 2+2 as string text, and 4 as value.
To get next entry in array during new cycle
Letting user click when all bubbles and texts are finished
Detecting click on any visible bubble, if we are ready for this click
To activate music in browser (not playing before interaction), after bubble press
Setting variable to large number that is for sure bigger than any answer for bubble equation
Storing answer of clicked bubble
Looking for lowest answer from all visible bubbles
Checking if player clicked on lowest bubble, if so, set the boolean for this
Stop clicking on other bubbles until everything is resolved
Pausing game timer, to not "steal" from player during animations
Sound for clicking on correct bubble (ding)

Swappig octopus animation for popping clicked bubble. Spine contains 7 different animations for 7 possible bubble positions. In Spine object "octopus_spine" these 7 animations are on numbers 1-7, we can take this value from instance variable "id" on bubble instances.
Waiting is hardcoded for spine animation length, 0.566 is time point, when tentacle hits bubble. Should be re-done for new conditions like "Spine animation reached xx%" in the future.
Deleting text on bubble in 1 frame, tween is not required, not noticable
Triggering adding bonus time to progress bar, as reward for correct answer

Bubble popping: creating emitter in bubble center, playing according sound effect, playing bubble sprite sequence.
Waiting 0.434 seconds for octopus to finish its animation
Waiting til bubble sequence is done, then hiding object
Waiting til octopus finishes its popping animation, then switching to idle animation.
After some pause, trigger despawning other visible bubbles, add 1 correct answer, and unpausing progress bar
If player already answered correctly 3 times in this session, hide hint with how to play information. It will not re-appear after new game, only after app reload
If answer was not correct, play according sound and create emitter to launch small red cross near click point
Sound for wrong answer
Removing rightmost heart, but there is certainly more elegant solution to control this
Looking for boolean change to trigger despawning
Sound for bubble despawning
Picking all remainig bubbles and playing their sprite popping sequences, hiding objects after it's done
Creating emitter in centers of all remaining bubbles
Removing text objects
If there are still time or lives to play, send trigger to spawn new batch of bubbles.
After defined time period, add another bubble to spawn until max amount (7)
After portion of correct answer from player, mix equations from next difficulty, that is stored in another array. Also increase rewards after correct answer.
Linking objects opacity to corresponding variables, that can be tweened later to animate appearance
If time has ended, prepare correct endgame message and background color for this message. Trigger game end and play sound.
Sound for Time is up popup
If last life was lost, prepare correct endgame message and background color for this message. Trigger game end.
Catching game end trigger. Send despawn bubbles trigger. Pause progress bar
Animating endgame message, showing that 0 lives or 0 time left
Updating final score value for popup
Changing spine animation to popup one, waiting til some point in animation, when octopus reaches to top of the screen
Adding sound for popup dragging in the water
Waiting til animation is finished, swapping to idle animation
Adding current score to array with all scores in the session, sorting array from top to bottom, forming text label for popup
Animating popup elements on top of popup sprite (which is in spine, therefore cannot stick labels and buttons to it)
Animations are done, play again button is ready for clicking
Popup finished animations, player is ready to interact with it
Check for play again button press/click
Creating particle trail for flying popup (when animation reaches certain point)
Sound for flying popup, waiting for right moment
Appearance of current score, top scores, play again button

"Popup out" animation is over, octopus can return to idle
Trigger new game
Deleting only current score, because it's recreated with each end game sequence, everything else hides
Shaking and rotating bubbles for idle animation
Ticking progress each second

Adding bonus time for correct answer
Highlighting progress bar frame each time when bonus is given

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Sticker
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects follow the position and rotation of the object they are stuck to.
description: This extension can be useful to:
* Stick accessories to moving objects
* Animate a skeleton
* Delete an object with another one
An example allows to check it out ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://stick-objects)).

eventsFunctions.description: Define helper classes JavaScript code.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineHelperClasses
eventsFunctions.sentence: Define helper classes JavaScript code

inlineCode: * Update the coordinates in the basisObject basis.
* It uses the basisObject coordinates from the previous frame.
* This way, the sticker can move relatively to it and still
// Save initial values to avoid calculus and rounding errors
* Copy the coordinates to use it the next frame.
* This method is also called by children to ensure
// If the behavior on the basis object has a different name,
// the objects will still follow their basis objects
// Follow parents 1st to avoid frame delays
object.setX(basisObject.getCenterXInScene() + object.getX() - object.getCenterXInScene() + deltaX * Math.cos(angle) + deltaY * Math.sin(angle));
object.setY(basisObject.getCenterYInScene() + object.getY() - object.getCenterYInScene() - deltaX * Math.sin(angle) + deltaY * Math.cos(angle));
// Unproportional dimensions changes won't work as expected
// if the object angle is not null but nothing more can be done
// because there is no full affine transformation on objects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ArrayTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A collection of utilities and tools for working with arrays.
description: > Note: The v2.0.0 is not compatible with v1.0.0. If you update, you wil have to update ALL USAGES of the extension.
This extension adds features like:
- Combining arrays (concatenate into new array, append all children to another array)
- Finding a value in an array (find index expression, contains condition)
- Reversing arrays
- Get a portion of an array (slice)
- Add and remove lots of children at specific indices at once (fill, splice, shift, pop, add at index)
- Randomness (shuffle children, get a random child)
- Mathematical operations using arrays (sum of all numbers, biggest/smallest number, average number, median number)
- Sort numbers in an array
- String inter-operation (split string into array, join array array children to string)

inlineCode: // Ensure the target is a clean new array
// The `|| undefined` replaces 0 with undefined, as having the argument as 0
// would make the array empty and is therefore useless.
// With undefined though, it doesn't stop until the end of the array,
// Copy each variable of the slice into the new array

parameters.description: The index to start the slice from

parameters.description: The index to end the slice at
parameters.longDescription:
Set to 0 to copy all of the array. If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.  
For example, slicing an array with 5 elements from 0 to -1 would take only elements from indices 0 to 3.
parameters.name: End

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces all arrays inside of an array with their children. For example, [[1,2], [3,4]] becomes [1,2,3,4].
eventsFunctions.name: Flatten
eventsFunctions.sentence: Flatten array _PARAM1_ (Deeply flatten: _PARAM2_)

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.description: The array to flatten
parameters.name: Array

parameters.description: Deeply flatten
parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.
parameters.name: Deep

eventsFunctions.description: Replaces all arrays inside of an array with their children. For example, [[1,2], [3,4]] becomes [1,2,3,4].
eventsFunctions.name: GlobalFlatten
eventsFunctions.sentence: Flatten array _PARAM1_ (Deeply flatten: _PARAM2_)

inlineCode: // Cast to array to ensure getAllChildrenArray returns the real array
// At the position of the array (i), remove 1 element (the array),
// and insert elements of b (the contents of the array) in-place of the array.
// Skip over the elements that were just added as we are flattening only 1 level deep
// If deep, the current element has been replaced with another, we need to recheck it on next iteration.
// If not deep, the current element is now the one after the array elements and needs to be checked too.
// In both case, decreasing by 1 is necessary.

parameters.description: The array to flatten

parameters.description: Deeply flatten
parameters.longDescription: If yes, will continue flattening until there is no arrays in the array anymore.

parameters.longDescription:
Set to 0 to copy all of the array. If you use a negative value, the index will be selected beginning from the end.  
For example, slicing an array with 5 elements from 0 to -1 would take only elements from indices 0 to 3.
parameters.name: End

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Behavior
parameters.name: Behavior

parameters.description: Duration of shake (in seconds) (Default: 0.5)
parameters.name: Duration

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

parameters.description: Keep shaking until stopped
parameters.longDescription: Duration value will be ignored
parameters.name: ShakeForever

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Behavior
parameters.name: Behavior

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: Stop shaking _PARAM0_

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Behavior
parameters.name: Behavior

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is shaking

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Behavior
parameters.name: Behavior

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Object
parameters.name: Object

parameters.description: Behavior
parameters.name: Behavior

parameters.description: Duration of shake (in seconds) (Default: 0.5)
parameters.name: Duration

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

parameters.description: Keep shaking until stopped
parameters.longDescription: Duration value will be ignored
parameters.name: ShakeForever

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
